comment._content:
From our own State Records Archivist: 

I believe that he is a Union soldier.  The image is reversed.  The cartridge box belt is over the "wrong" shoulder and the writing on the bottom of the oval frame is backwards.  That writing reads, in part, "... UNION NOW AND FOREVER ... ."  There are United States flags in the upper corners.  Finally, the belt buckle is the standard "US" oval buckle commonly used by Union troops.
